title: Author Correction: B-cell-specific checkpoint molecules that regulate anti-tumour immunity
author: Lloyd Bod
excerpt: Nature - Author Correction: B-cell-specific checkpoint molecules that regulate anti-tumour immunity
text: Correction to: Nature https://doi.org/10.1038/s41586-023-06231-0 Published online 21 June 2023In the version of the article initially published, there was an error in Fig. 3e where a representative flow plot from the anti-Tim-1 + anti-PD-1 group (combination treatment) was inadvertently presented in place of the isotype control group flow plot and has been corrected in the HTML and PDF versions of the article. The original and corrected Fig. 3e are shown below as Fig. 1.Fig. 1: Original and corrected Fig. 3e.Full size image Author informationAuthor notesLloyd BodPresent address: Massachusetts General Hospital Cancer Center, Department of Medicine, Massachusetts General Hospital, Harvard Medical School, Boston, MA, USAJingwen ShiPresent address: BeiGene, Beijing, ChinaJohannes FesslerPresent address: Division of Immunology and Pathophysiology, Medical University of Graz, Graz, AustriaAviv RegevPresent address: Genentech, San Francisco, CA, USAAuthors and AffiliationsEvergrande Center for Immunologic Diseases, Harvard Medical School and Brigham and Women’s Hospital, Boston, MA, USALloyd Bod, Yoon-Chul Kye, Jingwen Shi, Alexandra Schnell, Johannes Fessler, Juhi R. Nature (2025). https://doi.org/10.1038/s41586-025-08858-7Download citationPublished: 17 March 2025DOI: https://doi.org/10.1038/s41586-025-08858-7
html:
Correction to: Nature https://doi.org/10.1038/s41586-023-06231-0 Published online 21 June 2023

In the version of the article initially published, there was an error in Fig. 3e where a representative flow plot from the anti-Tim-1 + anti-PD-1 group (combination treatment) was inadvertently presented in place of the isotype control group flow plot and has been corrected in the HTML and PDF versions of the article. The original and corrected Fig. 3e are shown below as Fig. 1.
